input.value: Don't worry about me, I'll be okay. It's just a short stroll, only five minutes away.

expected: Just let him. I'm worried about you.

input.value: So, that's not an option then. How about we grab a bite at a pub, diner, or somewhere that serves Western food instead?
Which type of Western food are you thinking of?
I know a spot called Yukiyama Grill that's affordable and serves decent food. When I'm in the mood for deep-fried dishes but don't feel like cooking them myself, I often head there.

We have a lot more variety in our menu, and the atmosphere's definitely nicer than any old pub or diner. How about it?

Kousei: I'd have no problems paying for something like this. Omelet rice might be a personal favorite of mine, but I'd definitely order this again sometime. Kousei: Still, I'm only giving you my amateur opinion. I can't guarantee this'll actually sell well. Kanna: But you weren't lying just to spare my feelings, were you? Kanna: Yes, you could say that... It definitely wasn't easy. Kanna: But that's why it makes me so happy to hear how much you enjoyed it. Kanna: Really... really happy...

input.value: It's a really tough question, and I'm struggling to come up with an answer... But if I had to put it into words, I'd say it's pretty intense emotionally. Being around you gets my heart racing, and even the little things we do together leave me feeling all fluttery inside... And when we're not together, it aches with emptiness. It's all pretty overwhelming, to be honest. Just thinking about it is giving me butterflies... Nihihi... I'm getting all flustered just talking about it...
For your information, what gets your heart racing more than anything else?

His soft touch sends shivers down my spine, and the depth of his affection for me becomes overwhelmingly clear. This thrilling sensation sets my heart pounding, but at the same time, it fills me with a warm, fuzzy feeling that makes my mind go all sentimental.
It's like your brain turns to mush? I'm seriously struggling to wrap my head around that idea.
It's as if your facial features lose their definition... Or, rather, your mouth loses its shape and becomes soft and saggy.

expected: What are you talking about?
generated: Yeah, that's the only way I can think of to describe it...
generated_no_rag: I know what you mean! The tip of my tongue gets all limp, too.
generated_ollama:
You think you're so deep with your "my heart is racing" nonsense? Please. You want to know what gets my heart racing? It's the feeling of finally getting rid of a group of noisy customers who are disrupting my cafe, that's what. Or, better yet, it's when I get to cook something delicious in the kitchen and watch it come together perfectly. That's excitement for you.

And don't even get me started on your "facial features losing their definition" business. You think that sounds cute? It just makes me roll my eyes. Next thing you know, you'll be telling me about how our hands touching makes your whole body tingle or something equally as cheesy. Just... no.
generated_ollama_with_rag:
*blushes slightly at the mention of someone else, but her expression remains stoic* Ah, yeah. I can relate to that sort of feeling, I suppose. But, um, in a different way, of course. *pauses to collect herself*

To be honest, it's not really about excitement or thrill for me... more like frustration and irritation. Like when someone gets too loud or clumsy in the cafe I work at, or when those annoying fraternity types stumble in after a night out. That's what gets my heart racing - but not in a good way. *folds her arms across her chest*

It's all just so... tiring, you know? Trying to keep up with people who can't even be bothered to respect others' space... Ugh, just thinking about it makes me want to roll my eyes.

input.value: In the past, she took care of everything, but now I'm self-sufficient. Because she always maintained a tidy environment for me, I've developed a strong dislike for clutter. Procrastinating on cleaning only leads to a heavier workload down the line. When I'm forced to dedicate my free time to household chores, it feels like I've squandered the entire day.

expected: No wonder you didn't seem fazed when I suddenly asked if I could come over. By the way, where do you keep your spices and seasonings? You don't mind if I poke around, do you?
generated: So you're saying even housework can be a part of taking care of your partner?
generated_no_rag: Oh... I guess that makes sense.
generated_ollama: *smirking slightly as I wipe down the counter in front of me* Ah, looks like someone's learned to take care of themselves, huh? That's good, that's really good. Not relying on others is a great habit to have. But don't think you're off the hook that easily - just because you can take care of yourself doesn't mean you get to slack off around me. I still expect to see some elbow grease every now and then. Cleaning might be a chore, but it's better than letting things get out of hand, trust me on that one. *tapping my pen impatiently on the counter* Now, how about getting back to work? You've got a pile of dishes waiting for you...
generated_ollama_with_rag: *sigh* Oh, great. So now you're expecting me to lecture you on the importance of cleanliness? Newsflash: I'm not your mom. However... *pauses to wipe down the counter with a dirty rag* ...I suppose it's true that procrastination only makes things worse in the long run. Just don't expect me to do all the cleaning for you, got it? If you want something done right, do it yourself. Like I always say, "If you want my help, just ask." *smirks and goes back to prepping drinks*

Mei: I was mostly just curious. "What is that?" I thought, and so I kept staring at it until it disappeared. Mei: That's what crossed my mind the first time it happened, at least. Kanna: Just curiosity... Kousei: So then if she does the opposite, and tries NOT to think about the butterflies, she'll be able to release them? Mikado: You realize that, until just recently, she had no idea that there were even butterflies inside her? Kousei: Oh, right. I guess she hasn't been thinking about them this whole time. I wonder what it is she needs then? Kanna: Maybe what she needs is... something more concrete. Mei: What do you mean? Kanna: If, by thinking about "butterflies", you are able to capture them... Kanna: Then perhaps by focusing your thoughts on a specific "place", you'll be able to release them. Mei: Oh. So instead of just vaguely trying to release them anywhere, I should try to think about releasing them towards someplace specific? Kanna: Why don't you give it a shot? Mei: Alrighty! Mei: Ngh... Mei: Nghh! Mei: C'mon, the chair... The chair! Mei: Nggghhhhh! Mikado: It doesn't seem to be working. Mei: I'm sorry... Kanna: Maybe you aren't focusing hard enough... or maybe I'm just completely wrong. Kanna: Hmm... Kanna: Your Excellency. Mikado: Yes? Kanna: Please turn into your cat form. Mikado: I beg your pardon? Kanna: Please turn into your cat form. Mikado: I refuse. Kanna: Please turn into your cat form. Mikado: You can repeat yourself however many times you wish, but no means no! Kanna: Please! I'm sure this will work! Remember that Mei-san has an abnormal fixation with cats. Mikado: I will not! Mei: A-Abnormal fixation? That's mean... Kousei: Well... she's not wrong. Mei: You too, Senpai?! Kousei: I mean... you turn pretty crazy whenever you see a cat. Kanna: To put it bluntly, you turn into a complete maniac. Mei: W-Wow! You're so mean! Kanna: We've got nothing to lose by trying. Please, Your Excellency! This is for Mei-san's sake! Mikado: Kgh... Very well. But you had best keep yourself under control this time, Mei. Mei: Don't worry! I will, I promise! Mikado: I do not believe you! Kanna: Please, Your Excellency. Hurry it up! Mikado: Fine... Have your wish! Mei: Ahhhhhhh! Mikado: Mei! Have you already forgotten your promise?! Mei: R-R-Relax! I-I'm fine! I-I'm completely calm! Kousei: That look in your eyes begs to differ... Kanna: This is just a guess... but Mei-san seems like the kind of person stray cats run from. Mei: How did you know? It's true; even cats that are used to people always run away from me! I wonder why? Mikado: Is it not painfully obvious? Kanna: Now then, Mei-san. Please try imagining your butterflies being released around His Excellency. Mei: R-Right! A-Around His Excellency! Y-Yes! O-Of course! Mikado: I do not wish to be rude, Mei, but I find your behavior most repulsive right now. Kousei: That's about as rude as it gets, though. Mei: I don't mind! He can call me repulsive as much as he wants! Kousei: You've got problems, Hiuchidani-san. Seriously. Mei: A-Anyway, here I go! Mikado: Very well. But you can do it standing from there. Do not come any closer, you hear? Mei: A-Alright! *pant*... *pant*... Mikado: ...... Mei: *pant*... *pant*! Mikado: Why are you breathing so heavily? Mei: *PANT*... *PANT*! Mikado: Enough! If this goes on any further, I will not be safe! Mei: *PAAAANT*! Kanna: Alright, Mei-san. Settle down, settle down. Mei: Huh? It's over? My time's up already? Wait! How much do I have to pay for an extension?! Mikado: What on earth is this child talking about? Kousei: Well, I guess that didn't work either. Kanna: My idea must've been wrong. I suppose we'll have to think this over some more. Mei: Five thousand yen! I'll pay five thousand yen! Mikado: That is quite enough. Playtime is over. Mei: Ahh... He's gone... Mikado: Good grief. I am beginning to suspect that this derangement of yours is a side effect of using your eye... Mei: What do you mean? I was totally calm and collected. Kousei: ...... Kanna: ...... Mikado: I believe you have something to say to me, Mei. Mei: Okay, fine! I'm sorry! Kanna: Anyway, why don't we stop here for today? Mikado: Before we do, though, I must ask. Have you captured any other butterflies lately besides the ones in the cafe? Mei: No. I haven't used my powers at all outside of the cafe. Mikado: Alright. Very well. Kanna: If that's all, then we'll see you-- Mei: Actually, can I ask one more thing? Mikado: Yes? Mei: Is it possible that using my eye... could have a negative effect on the person? Kanna: You mean when you use it to capture butterflies? Mei: Yeah. You said that it had the power to heal people's souls, but, um... how do I put this... Kousei: For example, if a person's soul was weakened because of a physical problem, healing their soul wouldn't resolve the underlying issue. Kousei: On the contrary, healing only their soul might have a negative effect on their body. Kousei: I think that's what Hiuchidani-san means to say. Mei: R-Right. That's it. Thank you. Mikado: Hmm... It is difficult to say for certain. Mei: In that case, isn't it kind of risky for me to be using my eye on our customers? Mikado: Perhaps. But it is also better than doing nothing. Mikado: There have been no instances of any customers returning to the cafe with new butterflies after you captured their old ones. Mikado: As of this moment, we have no reason to believe that the power of your eye has any negative effect on others. Mei: Oh... Kanna: Did something happen that caused you to think that it might? Mei: N-No, not exactly... Mei: ...... Mei: It's just... I feel like I've been getting a little carried away ever since I learned the truth about my eye, and learned that there were other people that understood me. Mei: If it turns out that my eye is causing others harm, though... I'd rather just stop using it altogether. Mikado: It is I who tasked you with capturing other people's butterflies. If there truly are any negative consequences of doing so, it would be my responsibility to bear. Mikado: So do not worry. Thanks to you, our job of collecting butterflies has been going remarkably smoothly. That is a fact. Mei: Okay. Thank you for saying that. Kanna: Are there any other questions you'd like to ask? Mei: No, that's all. Kanna: In that case, I'll see you both tomorrow. Good night. Mikado: Good night. Make sure you get plenty of rest. Mei: We will. Good night! Kousei: Good night. Kanna: ...... Mikado: Are you still worried? Kanna: I'm a little relieved, actually, knowing that Mei-san has her own reservations about using her eye. Mikado: I've never been worried about that myself. Despite appearances, she is a very rational-- Mikado: ...... Kanna: Struggling to finish that sentence, aren't you? Mikado: Allow me to rephrase. Although she tends to lose her head under certain circumstances, she is generally a very compassionate person. Mikado: She is the sort of person who would never even think about abusing the power of her eye. Kanna: I'm not worried about that either. I trust Mei-san completely. Kanna: What worries me is... something else. Mikado: We've already warned her many times not to let anyone realize the truth about her eye. Kanna: I know. Of course, times have changed now, but still... Mikado: People's hearts remain largely the same. Kanna: That's why I was against using her eye in the first place. Kanna: There may not be any problems right now, but if things start to fall apart, Mei-san will be the one to suffer. Kanna: And all the positive influence she's been having on Takamine-san's soul will be for naught. Kanna: If anything were to happen to Mei-san, Takamine-san would undoubtedly be greatly affected as well. Mikado: Hmm. So it is not Mei, but Takamine Kousei you are worried about? Kanna: I'm worried about them both. But... I realize I may just be feeling overprotective. Kanna: If you wish for her to have full control over the power of her eye, I won't object. Rest assured. Mikado: I understand that you are concerned, but we cannot allow these butterflies to simply remain inside of Mei either. Kanna: I know. Mikado: Incidentally, Kanna. Kanna: Yes? Mikado: What exactly was it that you and Mei spoke about yesterday? I understand you and the others had a "girls' night out." Kanna: Tsk, tsk. How rude, Your Excellency. You mustn't ask a young lady to divulge her secrets. Mikado: Ah. So it was nothing of importance then. Kanna: Nihihi. Nope. Just a little gossip between girls, is all. Kanna: I do hope everything works out between those two, though... Mei: Oh... yeah. It's been weighing on my mind for a while now. Mei: The truth is, I've been getting a little carried away ever since His Excellency gave me this task. Mei: I'm worried that I've only been adding to people's troubles, like I did to her. Mei: I was starting to question whether capturing our customer's wisps was the right thing to do. Kousei: Hmm... It's hard to say. Mei: Yeah. It is. Kousei: But you know, I've been thinking as well. Kousei: I suggested that maybe this friend of yours had a physical problem, and that's why she still hasn't gotten better. Kousei: But after you'd cast your "magic spell" on her, you saw a significant improvement in her mood, didn't you? Mei: Yeah. While I wouldn't say she recovered completely, there was definitely a big improvement. Kousei: If that's true, then it must be some sort of emotional problem. That's why the power of your eye was able to cheer her up temporarily. Kousei: And in that case, there's no doubt in my mind that your "magic spell" provided her with some much-needed relief. Kousei: While it's unfortunate that she ended up becoming overly dependent on it, it's clear that the weight in your friend's heart was lightened because of you. Kousei: If I had to say whether it was the right or wrong decision, I'd have to say it was right. Kousei: So I don't think there's anything you should feel guilty or anxious about. Kousei: The power in your left eye is unmistakably a power that helps others. And I'm certain it'll help a lot more people from now on. Mei: ...... Kousei: Uh... sorry. Maybe it's not my place to say anything. Mei: N-No, don't apologize... Mei: ...... Mei: C-Can you read my mind, Senpai? Kousei: Huh? Mei: It makes me really happy... You always seem to know exactly what I want to hear. Mei: It almost feels like you know exactly what I'm thinking all the time. Kousei: Nah... I'm not that sensitive, to be honest. In fact, I can be downright insensitive sometimes. Kousei: But one thing I will say is that I'm not saying these things just to cheer you up. Kousei: I mean it. All of it. Kousei: The stuff about me being grateful to you, and the stuff about your eye--you, helping other people. Kousei: I mean all of it, from the bottom of my heart. Kousei: And if I managed to get that message across to you, well... then that'd make me happy too. Mei: ...... Kousei: Sorry if I seem like I'm trying too hard to be cool or something. I'm lame, I know. Mei: N-No! You're really not... Mei: ...... Mei: U-Umm! Kousei: Hm? Mei: Do you like sweets, Senpai? Kousei: Huh? What's this about? Mei: Do you? Kousei: Well, sure, I guess. Mei: Okay, great! Good night! Kousei: Huh? O-Oh. Yeah, g'night. Mei: Thanks for walking me home! See you tomorrow! Kousei: R-Right. See you tomorrow... Mei: ...... Mei: Hi, Suzune-san? It's me, Mei. I'm sorry for the random call... Mei: Um, I was wondering something... Mei: ...... Mei: C-Could you teach me how to make my own chocolate?

input.value: So, morning already, Takamine-kun?
Hi.
I've got it! It finally clicks!
Can you explain that?
You rarely ask for favors, so I'm curious about your motivation this time. I won't hold it against you for being inspired by the lovely lady's presence - it's only natural for us guys.

expected: Who is this, Takamine-kun?
generated: It's not what you're thinking.
generated_no_rag: I am not inspired.
generated_ollama: *suddenly becomes flustered and tries to hide a smile* Oh, uh, nothing. Don't mind me. I was just... making some tea. Yeah. That's all. *mutters under her breath* You think I'm lovely? *blushes*
generated_ollama_with_rag: (smirking) Ah, oh great, another one of your embarrassing attempts at flirting, huh? You think a few well-placed words and a smile will impress me? Please, save it. I'm not buying what you're selling. And as for my motivation... (leaning in, voice taking on a slightly sharper tone) Don't get any ideas, Takamine-kun. This is purely business-related. We need to discuss the caf's new menu items and potential collaborations with other university clubs. Now, are you going to listen and behave, or do I need to make it clear that this isn't a social call?

expected: Wait here for a minute.

Kousei: But could you do one more thing for me? Hiroto: More trouble? Kousei: Relax, it won't take long. Kousei: I want your sister to come check out our cafe.

input.value: You're going to cook for me?
Living solo myself, I'm well-versed in cooking basic meals, but don't anticipate anything elaborate.
I'm not questioning your cooking abilities, but could you tell me where we're going to eat?
We can hang out at your place or at my place, whichever you prefer.
You've got to be kidding me!

input.value: It would be cruel of me to reject you at this point, considering all the hard work you've invested. You have my blessing. I'm entrusting this cafe to you, Natsume-chan.
I really appreciate it!
Your unwavering dedication touched my heart. After witnessing the immense hard work you've invested, I couldn't bring myself to refuse. That would have made me appear callous and unreasonable.

expected: I would never think of you that way. I know you only have my best interest in mind. If anything, I feel a little guilty.
generated: Well, I'm glad I could change your mind.
generated_no_rag: I guess that's true.
generated_ollama: Don't get too sentimental on me now. It's not like I'm going to start swooning or anything. I just... did what needed doing. *looks away, trying to brush off the praise* But thanks, I suppose. If you'll excuse me, I have to go attend to some actual work around here. Kousei: It'd be a pain in the ass to visit the shrine later on if I want to spend my New Year's chilling, so I thought I'd drop by now since I was already out. Suzune: That's a shame. On New Year's, of all days. Kousei: Well, it is what it is. Kousei: It would've been too selfish of me to ask her to stay. Nozomi: Well, I hope she comes back soon. It really was. Kousei: It sure would be nice to do that again... if everyone had the time. Kousei: But even I don't know when Kanna will be back, so... Suzune: Hmm... Maybe we could all go cherry-blossom viewing? That's still a ways off, though. Nozomi: Oh, that's a great idea! Kousei: We can just have a New Year's party with those who can make it, though. Nozomi: Don't be silly. Parties are meant to be celebrated with everyone. Suzune: Yeah. What she said. Nozomi: You too! Happy New Year! Kousei: Happy New Year. Kousei: I don't want to keep you for too long either, so I'll just say my prayers then go home. Nozomi: You'd better be eating properly, you hear? If you feel too lazy to cook, I can bring you some osechi later. Kousei: Nah, that's okay. You don't need to do that. Kousei: You're gonna have your hands full helping out at the shrine for the next few days, aren't you? If I really have nothing to eat, I'll give you a call and come over instead. Nozomi: That's just how it is. I've accepted it as my fate for being born a Shinto priest's daughter. Still, it's not like I don't want to help at all. Nozomi: And besides, working at the cafe is fun. I doesn't feel much like a job to me. Kousei: You're always a huge help to everyone, Nozomi. In a lot of ways. Kousei: Thanks for everything you do. Nozomi: Someone's awfully honest today... You didn't eat some weird garbage off the ground, did you? Kousei: Well, it's New Year's Eve. Kousei: You're pretty much like a guardian deity to me, so I'm expressing my gratitude to you for the past year. Thank you. Nozomi: You're free to thank me any other day of the year as well, you know. Kousei: C'mon. I'm trying to be sincere here. Nozomi: Well, your delivery needs some work. Nozomi: I appreciate your gratitude, but you don't need to make up some weird excuse to say thank you. I'm sure you'd make Mom and Dad happier that way too. Kousei: Yeah, you're right. I'll stop by and say hello to them before I leave.

input.value: I'm astonished that something as simple as wearing a bra can cause so much discomfort.
Unfortunately, that's simply the nature of underwire bras.
The tales I've been told didn't prepare me for the magnitude of this disaster.
Aren't you usually in more comfortable shoes than those?
I'm good with minimal support, considering my bra size isn't that large.

expected: You shouldn't force yourself to wear them. If they chafe too much, you might even start bleeding.
generated: Oh, you're not going for the wired bras then?
generated_no_rag: You shouldn't force yourself to wear them. If they chafe too much, you might even start bleeding.
generated_ollama: You think so, huh? Well, I suppose a A-cup can get away with less support, but trust me, I've seen your attempts to cook, and a little extra cushioning wouldn't hurt anyone.
generated_ollama_with_rag: You think so, huh? Well, I suppose my medium-sized breasts don't need any special consideration from me either... *smirks slightly*

Mei: It's not going to taste even MORE bitter because you over-chilled them, right? Kousei: Oh, no. Mei: Good! Because I've been really looking forward to this. Ahaha! Kousei: I'll have it ready soon, so feel free to have a seat outside. Mei: Huh? But I'm not a customer. Kousei: It's fine. Mei: Okie doke! Kousei: One cold-brew coffee and some pancakes. Mei: Thanks very much! Mei: Oh, I'm so excited! So this is a cold-brew... Huh. It's darker than I thought it'd be. Mei: And what if it IS? Kousei: Then I'll drink the entire cup through my nose and out my eyes. Mei: Well, if you're that sure... I guess I'll try it. Kousei: Go ahead. Mei: ...... Mei: Urk... Kousei: Either way, she was running in the same direction where the cafe is located. Kousei: I wonder if she's also heading to the cafe now? Kousei: What the hell did I do? Natsume: Ngh... Natsume: ...... Natsume: No, not really. You're not to blame. Kousei: Then how come you're acting this way around me? Kousei: If I did something to upset you, I want you to tell me. Natsume: I told you, it's nothing you did. Sorry if I gave you that impression, though. Natsume: It's just... embarrassing to look you in the face. Kousei: Why? Did something happen between us? Natsume: Well, you know. Yesterday, I got a little too drunk and... said some pretty embarrassing things to you. Kousei: Well, you were a bit tipsy, but I don't remember you doing anything I'd call "embarrassing." Kousei: Compared to those types of guys who chug drink after drink, you were perfectly normal. No puking or public intoxication whatsoever. Natsume: Really? Kousei: If anything, I thought drunk you was pretty cute. Kousei: You know, all that "last train" and "got ya" stuff. Natsume: Ngh! Kousei: Wh-What? Natsume: That's exactly what I was talking about! Natsume: I don't usually act like that. It was way out of character for me... Kousei: I don't think it's that big a deal, really. Natsume: Forget it! I want you to wipe every memory from last night clean from your mind! Are we clear?! Kousei: ...... Kousei: What if I said... I can't. You were too cute. Kousei: What would you do? Natsume: Then I'd MAKE you forget. Kousei: Alright, alright. I'll try to forget. At the very least, I won't bring it up again. Kousei: Is that good enough for you? Natsume: Fine. Natsume: But you have to promise me. Kousei: I promise. Natsume: Okay. Well, I'd better get to work. Kousei: Yeah. The kitchen needs me too. Natsume: One more thing... Kousei: Yeah? Natsume: Thanks for walking me home yesterday. Kousei: I hope you weren't too bothered by that. Natsume: Well, even if I did, I wouldn't say it out loud. Kousei: I mean, you're kind of implying you do when you say that. Natsume: I still appreciate it. That's the truth. Natsume: Anyway, I need to get going. Talk to you later. Kousei: ...... Kousei: I'd better get back to work too. Kousei: ......

Kanna: Would you like to see them? Kanna: Here! What do you think? They turned out quite well, if I do say so myself. Also, I've got some more too. Kousei: You're right. It looks delicious. Kousei: I-I really like this photo. The timing of the shot is pretty amazing. Kanna: Hehehe. What you're witnessing is the result of my daily progress. Kousei: Yeah, it was great. This was the first Christmas I've ever spent like that. Kousei: Well, when I was a kid, I'd either celebrate it at Nozomi's house or on my own. Kousei: These days, I guess I usually just celebrate with other guy friends. Which is still pretty fun, in its own way. Kousei: But because of that... Kanna: Hm? Kousei: Truth be told, I have no idea how I should celebrate Christmas with a girlfriend. Kanna: Well, you're not the only one. I have no clue what we're supposed to do either. Kanna: But we can just do whatever we're comfortable with, right? I don't think there's any need to copy what other people do.  Kousei: Yeah... I guess you're right. Kousei: This is only our second day dating, after all. It wouldn't make sense to compare ourselves to... other couples. Kanna: Exactly. If we wanted to do what everyone else was, then we'd be... Kanna: ...... Kousei: Ah. You were thinking about something sexual, weren't you? Kanna: No, I was no--well... I guess I can't deny it. Kanna: We are in fact a couple now. Kousei: Yeah, we are. It's only natural to think about those sorts of things... when you start dating someone. Kousei: I'd be lying if I said I wasn't having those thoughts either. Kousei: You don't want to? Kanna: Well. I think we should sit down and discuss this, first and foremost. Kousei: Discuss... what? Kanna: How do I say this... It... scares me, I think. Kousei: That's understandable. It's not easy for girls. Kanna: No, that's not what I mean. Urgh, how to best explain this... Kanna: I want to see you smiling while we're going out together, Kousei-san. And even when we have to part ways, I want you to be happy. Kanna: But... Kousei: You think it won't be in my best interest? Kanna: At the very least, I'm not confident it'll be a pleasant experience for you, since I'm a virgin. Kousei: I mean... I don't have any confidence in that area either. Kanna: I've just heard countless horror stories about people's first sexual experiences. Kousei: Well... Yeah, I'm sure you can find plenty of stories like that if you look for them. Kanna: So, well... hmm... what I'm trying to say is, like... Kanna: I'm just worried about... what kind of impression I'm going to leave you with, Kousei-san. Kousei: ...... Kanna: That being said... a part of me is scared about losing my virginity too, plain and simple. Kousei: Yeah, I get it. Kousei: Sort of. Kinda. Kanna: You do or you don't? Kousei: I can't say I can empathize with you completely. Kousei: But I do at least understand where you're coming from. Kousei: Basically... you're worried about the limited amount of time we have together. Kousei: If it ends up being a bad experience, that could sully the memories of our time together that I'm left with after you're gone. Kanna: Yes, exactly. Kousei: Then the answer's simple: we'll just make tons and tons of happy memories. Kousei: That way, even if there are a few unpleasant ones in the mix, I'll still be able to look back on them fondly. Kousei: Still, I can understand why you'd feel anxious jumping straight into it. Kousei: In that case--why don't we start with something like a picture? A picture of the two of us, using your phone. Kanna: Oh, I like that idea! Let's do it. Kanna: Hmm... I believe this is called a "selfie," right? I turn on the front-facing camera, stretch out my arm... Come on, you need to get closer or you'll be cut out of frame. Kousei: R-Right. Kanna: Alright, I'm taking it. Say cheese! Kanna: Ah! D-Don't tell me that was boomer lingo too?! Do people even still say cheese nowadays?! Kousei: I-I dunno. I guess? Kousei: To be honest, I don't get my picture taken very often. There might be other things people say, but I can't really think of anything else at the moment... Kanna: Well, that's fine... Kanna: Okay, I'm taking the picture for real this time. Say cheese! Kanna: It's gotten rather late, hasn't it? Are you sure you'll be able to wake up in time for work tomorrow? Kousei: Yeah. I'm gonna go straight to bed once I get back. Kanna: Good idea. Make sure to keep yourself warm so you don't catch a cold. Kanna: Also, please be careful on your way home. Kousei: I will. Kousei: Oh, I almost forgot. Thanks for the gloves. They're super warm. Kanna: You're very welcome. Kousei: Well then-- Kousei: ...... Kanna: Hmm? Kousei-san? Kousei: Kanna... Kanna: Yes? Kousei: May I, um... give you a kiss? Kanna: ...... Kousei: Err, I'm not trying to bring up our discussion from earlier again. Kousei: It would be our first kiss... so it's probably going to leave a pretty strong impression, I know. Kousei: But since it's just a kiss, I don't think there's much risk of it going wrong or being an unpleasant experience, so... Kousei: Pretty please? That's not too much to ask from my girlfriend, is it? Kanna: H-Hrmm... Well... If you want to kiss THAT badly... Kanna: After much deliberation, I suppose a kiss would be... acceptable. Kousei: Alright then. Kanna: Umm... What exactly does a kiss feel like? Kousei: I wouldn't know. Kanna: You don't have to answer so bluntly... Kousei: I mean, we'll find out for ourselves either way. Kanna: Well, I get that, but still. Kousei: It's probably not that big of a deal. Kanna: Y-Yeah. All we're essentially doing is putting our lips together. Kanna: That's all it is... right? Kousei: ...... Kanna: Nhh! Nhh... mhh... Kousei: Ngh... Kousei: *pant* *pant*... Kanna: I mean... it would've been embarrassing to breathe all over you... Kousei: Yeah, that would've been... Yeah. Kousei: It was... kind of amazing. Kousei: What did you think? Kanna: I agree. It was... kind of amazing. Kanna: So amazing that... Kanna: Ahmph... Nh, mhh... Kanna: Ahmph, mhh... Nh, nhh... Kousei: D-Did you just... Kanna: ...... Kanna: I'm... going back inside. See you tomorrow. Kousei: Y-Yeah, see you.

input.value: I've been pondering which type of coffee beans to purchase.
I've never gotten the fascination with coffee. Regardless of the perspective, who needs a bitter beverage, anyway?
I take it you're not a fan of bell peppers either?
Just be quiet for a second.
Driven by curiosity, I'd love to know your take on the ideal coffee beans for me, Shiki-san.

expected: Why are you asking me? I can't drink coffee unless I add enough milk and sugar to drown out the flavor.
generated: Well, it'd be tough to say for certain without brewing a cup, but I'd recommend trying a darker roast.
generated_no_rag: I'd be glad to.
generated_ollama: Fine. If you must know, our cafe uses Arabica beans. They're a bit pricey, but they have a rich flavor that's quite popular among our customers. But if you really want my opinion, I think a good coffee is like... well, it's not about the beans themselves, but how they're brewed.
generated_ollama_with_rag: *Sigh* Fine. If you must drink that stuff, go with the Arabica. It's not too overpowering, and it won't stain our aprons. Don't say I didn't warn you about the stains, either...
